Yonatan Assefa Mekonnen  Student
yonatanassefa60@gmail.com
Bahir Dar, Ethiopia
Ethiopian
GitHub profile
Portfolio
+251932223954
14th┬áSeptember┬á2003
LinkedIn Profile
Coursera Profile
Profile
I am a software engineering student in Bahir Dar 
University. My primary interest lays in Backend Web 
Development, Databases , general problem solving, 
data structure and algorithms. 
Skills
Backend Web Development
Worked primarily using Springboot, Laravel, FastAPI, 
Django and Django-Rest-Framework for API 
development.
Data Structure and Algorithms with 
python and c++
I worked with data structures and algorithms in python 
and c++
Database schema development and 
MS SQL
Leveraged MS SQL and postgreSQL databases for 
schema development
Web Apps deployment with Render.
Flutter
Worked on basic mobile applications with Flutter.
HTML, CSS, JS and React
Frontend development with HTML, CSS, JS and React 
JS
Courses
Programming For Everybody(Python Data 
Structures), University Of Michigan
Projects
Job Finder Telegram Bot
A telegram bot that searches for available jobs from the 
most popular telegram channels in Ethiopia and uses 
AI to match how fitting the user might be for the role 
from the simple profile setup they give and if it appears 
compatible, sends alerts to the user about the job. 
LogForge
Logforge is a multi-platform, simple and easy to 
integrate audit logging package(DevTool) for popular 
backend frameworks like Django, Laravel and FastAPI. 
it is published on PyPi and Packagist. 
Local Services Aggregator Mobile App
An application that serves as a platform for aggregating 
local services. It connects customers who need services 
with local providers who can offer them.
AACEAC
An employee tracking system for the Addis Ababa City 
Ethics and Anti-corruption Commission (AACEAC). It 
provides a comprehensive system for managing 
employees, their roles, and their positions within the 
commission's hierarchical organization.
Organizations
Prodigy Infotech, 
Backend Web-Development Intern
January┬á2025 ΓÇô February┬á2025
Quantum Technologies PLC, Intern
March┬á2025
Languages
English
IELTS 7.5 band score
Amharic

fields.cv_text:
SOPHIA FOSTER
Senior Software Engineer | Agile Development | DevOps Integration
44 20 7123 4567 Email linkedin.com Bristol, UK
SUMMARY
Enthusiastic software engineer with over 7 years of experience, specialised in C# development, service-oriented architecture, and Agile methodologies. Demonstrated ability to innovate and drive successful project outcomes.
EXPERIENCE
Lead Software Developer
Tech Innovate Ltd
03/2019 - Present┬á Bristol, UK
Directed a team of 5 developers to design and implement microservices in C#, with a focus on modularity and reusability, leading to a 30% reduction in code duplication across services.Implemented robust security practices in application development that decreased vulnerability exposure by 40% in our software releases.Integrated NoSQL databases into existing systems for high-volume data handling, improving system performance by 25%.Crafted a CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins, which reduced deployment time by 50%, and facilitated frequent feature releases.Introduced React framework in several key front-end projects, resulting in increased user satisfaction scores by 20%.Drove process improvements in the Agile development cycle that heightened team productivity by 35%, delivering projects on an average 15% ahead of schedule.
Software Engineer
Digital Dynamics Inc
09/2016 - 02/2019┬á Bristol, UK
Led the development of a scalable E-commerce platform using Angular, which handled a volume of 100K transactions per month.Spearheaded the migration of services to AWS, which enhanced system availability to 99.99%.Developed and deployed messaging solutions with RabbitMQ that supported asynchronous processing and reduced load times.Authored comprehensive documentation that increased team efficiency by facilitating knowledge sharing.Instigated TDD practices that improved code quality and decreased post-deployment bugs by 70%.
Software Developer
Solutions Tech Ltd
01/2015 - 08/2016┬á London, UK
Collaborated in a cross-functional team to deliver a client portfolio management system using C#.Introduced Docker for containerization, which simplified environment setups and shortened new developer onboarding from weeks to days.Optimized relational database schemas and queries, achieving a performance boost of 50% for data-intensive applications.Engaged in code reviews and pair programming, ensuring high coding standards and shared best practices.
EDUCATION
MSc Software Engineering
University of Bristol
01/2013 - 01/2014┬á Bristol, UK
BSc Computer Science
University of Bath
01/2009 - 01/2012┬á Bath, UK
KEY ACHIEVEMENTS
Team Productivity Leadership
Championed Agile process improvements that increased team productivity by 35% within the Tech Innovate team.
E-commerce Platform Success
Led the Angular-based e-commerce project that successfully processed over 100K transactions monthly at Digital Dynamics.
AWS Migration Analyst
Pioneered the migration to AWS at Digital Dynamics, achieving 99.99% system availability for critical services.
Database Performance Optimisation
Optimised database performance by 50%, enhancing data retrieval speeds at Solutions Tech.
www.enhancv.com

fields.cv_text:
Gelila Dawit Asrat
+251939015758 Γùç gelila.d.asrat@gmail.com Γùç Ethiopia Γùç LinkedIn Γùç GitHub
SUMMARY
Adaptable and motivated Software Engineer with a strong foundation in building scalable, efficient, and maintainable
software solutions. Passionate about leveraging technology, solving complex problems, and continuously learning to
create innovative and impactful systems.
EXPERIENCE
Backend Developer
Adot(https://a2sv.org/)
Mar '25 ΓÇö Present
Kigali, Rwanda(Remote)
Motherhood Companion App designed to support women throughout pregnancy and - early motherhood.
Contributed to backend development by debugging existing features and fixing issues.
Built API endpoints to support additional functionality within the platform.
Backend Developer Intern
Africa to silicon valley(https://a2sv.org/)
Mar '25 ΓÇö Jun '25
Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
Developed and deployed a Telegram bot with webhook based message handling using Python and Flask.
Built a multilingual translation platform(PassMe) with Go backend and Python translation service.
Developed RESTful APIs in Go to handle translation, user input, and direction-based logic.
Integrated OpenAI APIs for translation, transliteration, speech-to-text, and text-to-speech functionalities.
Followed modular Clean Architecture with separation between delivery, usecase, and infrastructure layers
Backend Web Development Intern
Prodigy InfoTech
Jan '25 ΓÇö Feb '25
Mumbai, India (Remote)
Built REST API with CRUD operations.Link
Integrated PostgreSQL, optimized queries, and ensured data persistence.Link
Implemented JWT authentication, and secure password hashing (bcrypt).Link
Enhanced performance with Redis caching, cache expiration, and invalidation.Link
PROJECTS
House Rental System ApplicationLink
Linked list project, C++
Sapphire Ai Note TakerLink
Architected and developed a complete mobile application using Flutter for the cross-platform frontend and
Python/Django REST Framework for the scalable backend.
Engineered an end-to-end AI pipeline that orchestrates a third-party Speech-to-Text service with the OpenAI
API to automatically transcribe spoken audio and generate structured, two-layer summaries ("Key Points" and
"Detailed Notes").
Designed and built a modular RESTful API to handle all CRUD operations for user-managed courses and
notes, ensuring a maintainable and scalable server side architecture.
Book Review AppLink
HTML/JS/CSS, Django Restframework
Recipe Sharing AppLink
Team work, Django Restframework
Flutter student note app
Developed a Flutter student note app with a Hive database for storing and managing student information, featuring a
simple UI that allows users to view, add, and edit records.
SKILLS
Programming GoLang, Python, Javascript, Nodejs, Dart
Databases MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Redis Caching
Frameworks/Tools Django, Django REST Framework, Postman
Security/API JWT authentication, bcrypt, REST API, CRUD operations
Soft Skills Data structure and algorithms, Problem solving, Communication skills
Languages Amharic, English, IELTS:7.5
CERTIFICATES
Udacity Nanodegree Program Completion Data Analysis Fundamentals, Udacity Jul '24
EDUCATION
Bachelor of Degree in Software Engineering in Software Engineering, Bahir Dar
University(CGPA: 3.69)
Apr '22 ΓÇö Jun '26
Bahir Dar, Ethiopia

academic_info.degree: Bachelor of Degree in Software Engineering

degrees.degree: Bachelor of Degree in Software Engineering

certifications: Udacity Nanodegree Program Completion Data Analysis Fundamentals

fields.raw_text:
@Opportunity_4_All 

Film Screening: Grandpa was an Emperor
≡ƒôà Till January 18, 2026
≡ƒôì Adwa Museum

Dates/Times
- Jan 9: 2pm
- Jan 10: 4pm
- Jan 11: 4pm
- Jan 16: 2pm
- Jan 18: 4pm

This award winning documentary follows Yeshi Kassa as she confronts difficult memories and seeks explanations about the Ethiopian Revolution of 1974 that toppled the government of her great-grandfather Emperor Haile Selassie.  This is a no holds barred account that confronts difficult questions about a period of Ethiopian history which our society has not properly dealt with, and which continues to affect not just the Imperial family but all of us of Ethiopian heritage to this day.

@Opportunity_4_All

Tony Elumelu Foundation (TEF) has officially opened applications across a range of entrepreneurship programmes designed to support and fund young African founders.
┬á
If you know any ambitious young Africans building businesses, or with strong business ideas, we encourage you to share this widely within your networks. These opportunities are open, competitive, and fully merit-based, and they continue to transform lives and communities across the continent.
┬á
Tony Elumelu Foundation Entrepreneurship Programme (Pan-African)
┬á
Open to entrepreneurs from all 54 African countries, across all sectors.
Successful applicants receive: ΓÇó US$5,000 non-refundable seed capital ΓÇó World-class business training ΓÇó Mentorship and lifelong access to TEFConnect ΓÇó Entry into AfricaΓÇÖs largest entrepreneurship ecosystem
┬á
Since 2015, the Programme has funded over 24,000 entrepreneurs, trained 2.5 million Africans, helped create 1.5 million jobs, and generated US$4.2 billion in revenue.
┬á
Applications close: March 25, 2026
 Apply via: www.TEFConnect.com
┬á

┬á
IYBA-WE4A Programme (Women-led Green Businesses)

A multi-partner initiative supporting women entrepreneursbuilding businesses in green and sustainable sectors across selected African countries.
┬á
Selected entrepreneurs receive: ΓÇó US$5,000 seed capital ΓÇó Tailored business and green-enterprise training ΓÇó Mentorship and investment-readiness support ΓÇó Lifetime access to TEFConnect
┬á
This programme is focused on sustainable agriculture, renewable energy, circular economy, eco-tourism, and other green sectors.
┬á
Applications close: 25 January 2026
Apply via: www.TEFConnect.net

Opportunity| IYCGE Fellowship Program 

We are pleased to invite applications from committed and passionate individuals to serve on the IYCGE Ethiopia National Team.

Available Positions:
1. Research Fellows 
2. Government Relations Fellow 
3. Public Advocacy Fellows 

General Roles & Responsibilities

a). Support research, policy analysis, and documentation on gender equality issues,
b). Engage with government institutions, civil society, and youth networks
c). Lead public advocacy, awareness campaigns, and community engagement
d). Contribute to national and international reporting and dialogue

Who Can Apply
a). Youth leaders, researchers, advocates, and professionals passionate about gender equality
b). Strong communication, teamwork, and commitment to social change
c). Experience in research, policy, advocacy, or community engagement is an added advantage.

Required qualifications2+ years of professional experience in backend or web application developmentStrong proficiency in Python or at least one backend language (e.g. Java, Node.js, C#, Go, or similar)Experience building and maintaining RESTful APIsSolid understanding of relational databases and data modeling (e.g. PostgreSQL)Experience working with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure)Experience with containerization and deployment workflows (e.g. Docker, CI/CD)Good communication skills and ability to work in a distributed, remote teamNice to haveExperience with Kubernetes or managed container platformsExposure to infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g. Terraform)Experience with WebsocketsExperience with Monitoring toolsBasic knowledge of frontend technologies (e.g. React)Experience operating production systems or participating in on-call rotations



Why us?

Be part of an international, dynamic, and highly skilled team in flat hierarchies where you can both make an impact and continue to learnContribute to our company values and do good for society by having your work enable actual medical products that improve patientsΓÇÖ livesPublish research that advances our mission and aligns with our core areas of expertiseEarn a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package (such as bike leasing, sports programs, etc.)Enjoy the agility of a start-up paired with the safety of a grown companyBenefit from flexible working hours, remote work and workationWe celebrate success together with various team events (e.g. Summer Party or Oktoberfest)




About us

                        ImFusion GmbH is a growing company located in Munich, conducting research, development and consulting in advanced medical image computing technologies and computer vision. Our customers include small and large medical device companies as well as academic research labs. We wish to expand our team with talented and motivated people.We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered. We celebrate diversity and welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our goal is to foster a culture of belonging, where different perspectives drive innovation and success.You think you can be a good fit? We'd love to hear from you!
                    



To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/imfusion-backend-web-application-developer-cloud-saas

    URL: http://sangoma.com


DescriptionWeb Developer┬áJoin Sangoma, a leader in business communications, as our Web Developer. We seek a motivated professional to join our team as you create high-quality, responsive, and accessible digital experiences. Sangoma is committed to Empowering Businesses with Essential Communications through our cutting-edge Unified Communications, UCaaS, CCaaS, VOIP, and Hybrid solutions, enhancing connectivity and streamlining communication for organizations of all sizes. Our ideal candidate will have strong front-end development┬áexpertise, a keen eye for detail, and the ability to transform Figma designs into functional, user-friendly web interfaces.┬áThis role requires proficiency in WordPress, React┬áand┬ámodern web technologies, as well as a solid understanding of SEO best practices and WCAG accessibility standards.┬áIf you thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy transforming creative concepts into user-centric experiences, we want to hear from you.┬á┬áYour Role:┬áAccurately translate Figma mockups into pixel-perfect, functional layouts.┬áDevelop and┬ámaintain┬áresponsive web pages and landing pages.┬áManage and customize WordPress themes and templates, ensuring performance and scalability.┬áImplement SEO strategies, including proper metadata, structured content, and site optimization.┬áEnsure WCAG compliance and accessibility best practices across all projects.┬áOptimize┬áwebsites for speed, performance, and cross-browser compatibility.┬áCollaborate with designers, marketers, and back-end developers to deliver user-centric solutions.┬áParticipate in code reviews, testing, and troubleshooting to┬ámaintain┬áhigh-quality standards.┬áBuild interactive components and standalone pages using React and other modern libraries.┬áStay up to date with emerging web technologies and propose innovative improvements.┬á┬á.┬áRequirementsYour Background:Bachelor's degree in computer science, Web Development, or equivalent work experience.3ΓÇô5 years of professional experience as a Web Developer.┬áExperience in a SaaS company within a telecom company preferred. Strong┬áproficiency┬áin HTML5, CSS3 (SASS/Tailwind), and JavaScript (ES6+).┬áAbility to read and implement Figma designs accurately into responsive, modern layouts.┬áHands-on experience with WordPress, including understanding of themes, templates, and plugins.┬áFamiliarity with front-end frameworks or libraries (e.g., Bootstrap, Vue.js, React) is an asset.┬áSolid understanding of web accessibility (WCAG), cross-browser compatibility, and responsive design principles.┬áExperience with version control systems (Git) and basic SEO practices.┬áStrong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and communication abilities.┬á┬áNice to Haves:┬áExperience with custom WordPress plugin development or PHP hooks.┬áFamiliarity with managed hosting environments and tools (e.g., WP-CLI, caching).┬áExposure┬áAPI integrations and marketing platforms (HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Tag Manager).┬áUnderstanding┬áAgile methodologies (Scrum or Kanban).┬áAbility to explain technical concepts clearly to non-technical stakeholdersBenefitsExtended Healthcare Plan (Medical, Disability, Dental & Vision)RPP - Group RRSPGroup Life - AD&D; - Critical Illness InsurancePaid Time Off BenefitsWork From Home - Flexible hours

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/sangoma-web-developer-remote-canada-and-or-united-states

Zencastr: Senior Fullstack Developer

Headquarters: Zencastr
    URL: https://zencastr.com


Empower the voices of the world @ Zencastr. If you want to push the world of podcasting into the future, come join a team who loves to live on the edge! We are a fully distributed team of smart people who are passionate about changing the world one voice at a time.
┬á
You should join us if you:


Have significant experience with Node.js and good knowledge of JS fundamentals


Have a good understanding of computer science fundamentals. You might not have gone to school for it, but you know the difference between heap and stack, different time complexities, and which patterns to use and when.


You are ambitious. You might want to build your own company one day or have tried to tackle the toughest tech problems just for fun.


You enjoy writing Javascript or Typescript


You have an eye for performance. Whether thinking about the latest client side bundling techniques, or the proper way to shard a mongo database, you want things to be fast.


You are just as comfortable working in a browser context or a┬ánode.js┬áruntime


You are a team player


You have good communication skills


What sets you apart:


You have a passion for high performance applications


You have significant open source contributions


You want to work in a fast growing startup. Which comes with the blood, sweat and tears of working to disrupt an established industry


You have empathy for the end user. A spec is a conversation starter, as an advocate for the end user you always are thinking about how to best serve their needs


You have an eye for code quality and you strive to uphold best practices in engineering, security, and design


Why you should choose us:


YouΓÇÖll be working with world class engineers, PhdΓÇÖs, and designers in a fully distributed team


Work in an agile and fast changing environment


Equity commensurate to your contribution in a profitable company


Health insurance


Unique challenges and the support and talent to solve them


4 weeks PTO


Freedom to work where you please


What weΓÇÖre looking for:


5+ years of Typescript, React, Node.js development


Strong document / key-value store knowledge (Redis, MongoDB)


Strong SQL knowledge


Strong HTML / CSS / React knowledge


Demonstrable knowledge of building scaleable consumer based apps


Strong experience with unit, integration, and load testing


Experience building APIs


Experience with cloud APIs (Google Cloud, Digital Ocean)


Bonus points if you have:


Experiencing working in high traffic, low latency applications


Good dev ops experience


Digital Signal Processing experience


Strong SQL knowledge


┬á
How to apply:
Apply at┬áhttps://jobs.ashbyhq.com/zencastr/c4c91cc0-c5f9-4773-ab04-d239f9455aee
We are flexible! For the right candidate we ask: What do you need to do your best work?

fields.raw_text:
Speechify Inc: Software Engineer, iOS Core Product

Headquarters: Florida
    URL: http://www.speechify.com


Overview
With the growth of our iOS app, being the #18 productivity app in the App Store category and also our recent recognition as Apple's 2025 Design Award for inclusivity, we find the need for a Senior iOS Engineer to help us support the new user base as well as work on new and exciting projects to push our missing forward. ┬á┬á
This is a key role and ideal for someone who thinks strategically, enjoys fast-paced environments, passionate about making product decisions, and has experience building great user experiences that delight users.
We are a flat organization that allows anyone to become a leader by showing excellent technical skills and delivering results consistently and fast. Work ethic, solid communication skills, and obsession with winning are paramount.┬á
Our interview process involves several technical interviews and we aim to complete them within 1 week.┬á
What YouΓÇÖll Do

Opportunity to lead key engineering and product decisions
Actively shipping production code for the Speechify iOS app
Work within a dedicated product team
Participate in product discussions to shape the product roadmap
Maintain and enhance the existing complex app architecture

An Ideal Candidate Should Have

Experience. You've worked on products that scaled to a large user base
Track record. You have worked on various products from inception to decent traction. You have been responsible for engineering the product
Customer obsession. We expect every team member whose responsibilities directly impact customers to be constantly obsessed about providing the best possible experience
Product thinking. You make thoughtful decisions about the evolution of your product and support internal teams and designers into taking the right direction
Speed. You work quickly to generate ideas and know how to decide which things can ship now and what things need time
Focus. WeΓÇÖre a high-growth startup with a busy, remote team. You know how and when to engage or be heads down
Technical skills. Swift, SwiftUI

Technical Requirements:

Swift Programming Language
SwiftUI experience
Experience in Multithreading Programming
Working with CI/CD infrastructure
Experience with Fastlane
SOLID principles, the ability to write every single class according to SOLID
Experience with Git and understanding of different Git strategies

What We offer:

A fast-growing environment where you can help shape the company and product
An entrepreneurial crew that supports risk, intuition, and hustle
The opportunity to make a big impact in a transformative industry
A competitive salary, a collegiate atmosphere, and a commitment to building a great asynchronous culture
Work on a product that millions of people use and where daily feedback includes users sharing that they cried when they first found the product because it was so impactful on their lives
Support people with learning differences like Dyslexia, ADD, Low Vision, Concussions, Autism, and Second Language Learners, and give reading superpowers to professionals all over the world
Work in one of the fastest growing sectors of tech: Intersection of Artificial Intelligence and Audio

Think youΓÇÖre a good fit for this job?┬á
Tell us more about yourself and why you're interested in the role when you apply.And donΓÇÖt forget to include links to your portfolio and LinkedIn.
Not looking but know someone who would make a great fit?┬á
Refer them!┬á
Speechify is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.┬á
Speechify does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/speechify-inc-software-engineer-ios-core-product

fields.raw_text:
Jiga: Full Stack Product Engineer

Headquarters: Anywhere
    URL: http://https:/jiga.io/about-us


What we're building
Jiga┬áis on a mission to help engineers build physical products faster. Think┬ánpm install┬áfor mechanical engineers - we're building the infrastructure that makes hardware development as fast as software.
How we actually work
WeΓÇÖre a small remote team made up of the best of the best. Our team members are distributed around the globe. While most of our product and engineering talent is located in Europe and Israel, youΓÇÖll also work with people from the US and Asia. Most of our work is made async, which is the secret sauce of our success.
High trust, low bullshit:┬áWe don't count hours or peek over your shoulder on Slack. We trust you to get your work done and tell us when something's wrong. You'll have real ownership over what you build: which means you'll make a lot of decisions about architecture and functionality without endless approval cycles. (If that sounds terrifying, we're probably not a good fit. If that sounds exciting, keep reading.)
Question everything:┬áSee something that doesn't make sense? Say it. Have a better way to do something? Just do it. We actually mean it when we say we want people to challenge the status quo and improve things. Our internal motto is ΓÇ£DonΓÇÖt drink the kool-aidΓÇ¥
No stupid Meetings:┬áOne weekly all-hands. One dev team sync. That's literally it. Everything else happens async in Slack or Loom. Your calendar will be beautifully, gloriously empty.
Actually friendly, not corporate friendly:┬áWe play games online every week (current favorite: Make it Meme). Once a year we fly everyone somewhere beautiful for our offsite (Greece, here we come). We genuinely like hanging out together, which turns out to be way better than forced "team building exercises."
What we value in engineering:
Simple > Complicated.┬áSimple code, simple architecture; Simple solutions are better than complex ones.
Ship it, then improve it.┬áPerfection is the enemy of done. Launch now, iterate forever.
Product > Engineering.┬áEvery line of code should make our users' lives better. We're not here to show off our algorithmic prowess - we're here to solve real business problems.
Financials
Jiga is fully funded, cashflow positive, with growing revenue MoM. We're completely transparent about our runway and finances - ask us anything.
You'll love it here if

You want to actually own things.┬áNot "ownership" where you need three approvals to change a button color. Real ownership where you decide what to build, how to build it, and when to ship it.
You're genuinely full-stack┬á- you're equally happy building a slick UI component or optimizing a database query. There's no task you'd refuse because it's "not your specialty."
You care about the product, not just the code. You want to understand┬áwhy┬áwe're building something and you'll push back if it doesn't make sense.
You are motivated to run a marathon┬áand ring the bell with us in 3-4 years from now.
Bureaucracy makes you want to scream. Multiple approval layers, process for the sake of process, corporate theatre - if these sound like your nightmare, welcome home.
You love shipping.┬áLike, you get genuinely excited when you push to production. That "it's alive!" feeling never gets old.
You work fast┬ábecause you're having fun, not because someone's watching you.

This might not be for you if

You hate ambiguity. You prefer clear, detailed task assignments and well-defined requirements
You like having management to check in, review and verify your work multiple times until itΓÇÖs perfect
You're looking for a cuddly, 9-5, corporate job where you can coast a bit
You like the smell of gasoline and motor oil while driving to the office every day (sorry, we are 100% remote)
You like weeks of architecting over-complicated solutions

(No judgment if that's what you want - it's just not what we are.)
What you need

3+ years building full-stack web applications end-to-end
Strong at React + Node.js. MongoDB experience is a great plus.
Experience building complex applications - you understand clean architecture, security, scaling, performance, and maintainability
Solid data modeling fundamentals
Product company experience (you've felt the joy and pain of real users)
Some overlap with GMT+3 working hours so we can actually talk to you sometimes

What we offer
No ping pong tables. No beer kegs. No "unlimited vacation" that nobody takes. No ice cream fridge at the office. Oh right, we don't even have an office.
Here's what we do have:

A small team where you matter┬á- we never compromise on people, that means you are part of the best team in the world.
Zero bureaucracy┬á- we hate process theatre as much as you do
Real ownership and responsibility┬á- make decisions, ship code, own the outcomes. Have real impact on the product from day 1.
Complete flexibility┬á- work from anywhere, set your own hours, take time off when you need it (parents and DMs are very welcome)
Genuinely high trust┬á- we trust you to do great work and be honest when things go sideways
A team that actually likes each other┬á- international, diverse, genuinely friendly people who enjoy working together
Generous stock options┬á- weΓÇÖre looking for partners to run a marathon with us, you will get a life-changing shares when we get to the finish line
Competitive salary and PTOs┬á- so you can also enjoy, relax and recharge
Self-development budget┬áfor books, courses, conferences, whatever helps you grow
Annual offsite┬áin beautiful places (greece, here we come!)
Fast-paced environment┬áwith tons of creative freedom
Hard, interesting problems with a┬áteam that's positioned to win big


To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/jiga-full-stack-product-engineer

Strong document / key-value store knowledge (Redis, MongoDB)


Strong SQL knowledge


Demonstrable knowledge of building scaleable consumer based apps


Strong experience with unit, integration, and load testing


Experience building APIs


Experience with cloud APIs (Google Cloud, Digital Ocean)


┬á
Bonus points if you have:


Experiencing working in high traffic, low latency applications


Good dev ops experience


Digital Signal Processing experience


Strong SQL knowledge


AI experience


┬á
How to apply:
Apply at┬áhttps://jobs.ashbyhq.com/zencastr/e5897c7a-4622-495b-a892-81763a2ef112
We are flexible! For the right candidate we ask: What do you need to do your best work?

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/zencastr-senior-backend-engineer-full-remote

Headquarters: Brooklyn, NY
    URL: https://resources.storetasker.com/become-an-expert?apply=true&source;=weworkremotely_best_2021


Shopify developers love to freelance with Storetasker.Endless, quality clients: from well known DTC brands to top agencies.┬áFully remote, flexible: work as much or as little as you want, wherever you want.┬áA talented and helpful community: it's freelance (with a team).Earn $100-$200 per hour: pick your clients, and send your own quotes or retainers.┬áWe've connected our community of Shopify developers to over 32,000 e-commerce brands. From new brands pre-launch, to some of the most successful Shopify Plus sites, to top creative agencies. Clients include: Alpha Industries, Boll & Branch, Superfluid, Jack Henry, Plenaire, and Fulton among many more. Why Storetasker?Endless clients & project opportunities: youΓÇÖll see between 5 - 50 new opportunities per day and can pick any lead you want.┬áYouΓÇÖll earn more: some experts are making $250k+ per year.┬áA high quality community: we carefully select about 5% of those who apply.┬áRemote: work from anywhere, anytime.┬áFlexible: take on as many clients as you want.No external ratings: youΓÇÖre already a professional. No need to prove it.┬áGreat Software: that makes it easy to manage more clients and increase billable hours.Support when you need it: we offer project support 7 days per week.┬áCommunity (not competition): you pick your clients, projects, and never compete against other Experts in the community.┬áLearn more and join! ItΓÇÖs confidential, and takes less than 5 minutes. Here's who we're looking for:Ambitious part time and full-time freelancers and boutique agencies.Who have 3+ years of Shopify experience, and 5+ years of web development experience.┬áAnd who have managed projects, deadlines, and communication successfully.┬áEspecially people with some of these skills:Front-end or full-stack Shopify developmentHeadless e-commerce developmentConversion rate optimizationE-commerce expertise and strategySEO┬áSite SpeedBuilder and/or ShogunIt takes just a few minutes to join.Here's what a few current members have to say:"Storetasker has changed my life - I'm not only making more, but I'm getting quality leads, a diverse slate of projects, and access to an amazing group of developers. Plus, I love the HQ team!" - Adan, United States, Storetasker Expert since March 2020"Storetasker has connected me with clients that would never have been possible without them. That combined with an incredible support network and community makes joining an amazing opportunity for any developerΓÇ¥" - Mark, England, Storetasker Expert since 2019"Storetasker has allowed me to live out my dreams as an independent developer - to move to Toronto and continue doing what I love: solving interesting problems and helping apparel companies grow." - Siah, Canada, Storetasker Expert since 2017Our Mission: We're a company built by ex-freelancers who know the ins and outs of being an independent entrepreneur. We've experienced first-hand the shortcomings of other freelance platforms and the pain-points of being fully independent. Our mission is to empower e-commerce entrepreneurs by giving them the experts, insights, and resources to succeed.┬á Questions? Reach out at experts@storetasker.com.

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/storetasker-senior-shopify-developer-remote-flexible-3

fields.raw_text:
WodBoard: Senior Rails developer

Headquarters: London
    URL: https://www.wodboard.com


We're looking for a senior rails developer to come work with us at WodBoard┬á WodBoard is gym management software that helps gym owners run their businesses and helps their customers, the gym members, live healthier lives.┬á The brand name won't make any sense unless you've walked into a functional fitness gym before so I'll move swiftly on...We're a bootstrapped company so there's no VCs to answer to.┬á That doesn't mean we're not ambitious though - there's a massive market we're going after and we want to create lasting change.┬á As a combination of these two things we've a heavy focus on getting stuff done.Our development ethos could be best described as "full DHH". Whilst there's some bits we don't 100% agree with we stick to the core Rails ethos and stack, focussing on what we can achieve with the technology, rather than the technology itself.┬á If you've enjoyed some of the blog posts on how Basecamp structure code, or enjoy the work of boringrails.com, you'd like working with us.We're a small (but mighty) tech team of 4 so you'll be jumping straight in and writing code for customers from day 1. There's also infrastructure/UI work/mobile app development work that happens and you can become involved in if you so wish.┬á The role has the opportunity to build into a CTO role for the right person.A little more about the role and us:

It's really refreshing using technology to do something that helps people in a real world tangible way.┬á Changing lives and increasing health through technology is very motivating!
We love simplicity.┬á We're fanatical about it.┬á This goes from our codebase, to our infrastructure, to how we operate as a company.┬á It can be harder work upfront but it sure makes life easier down the road.
You'll need strong ownership skills.┬á As a small team we don't have project managers.┬á You're responsible for your tasks so you'll need to be good at taking ownership and reporting back to the team.
An ability to renegotiate requirements as you get into the technical details is most welcome!┬á In Computer Science there's hard problems and hard problems that don't need solving.┬á We are constantly asking ourselves if there's an easier way to do something.
We spend a lot of time talking to our customers and understanding their problems.┬á This won't ever change.┬á Be prepared to go back and evaluate previously held assumptions on new features after testing with beta customers

The position is fulltime and by no means do you need to be into health/fitness to work here (only about 50% of our staff are).┬á It's fully remote position but you'd need to be on an EU timezone so there's sufficient overlap with the rest of the team.┬á We also do a full team meetup in person twice per year.

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/wodboard-senior-rails-developer-1

OnTheGoSystems: Senior Python Developer

Headquarters: Remote
    URL: http://onthegosystems.com


WeΓÇÖre looking for a developer who┬áprefers solving open problems over following strict specs, and who enjoys shipping meaningful work fast.
Become part of OTGS and work with senior engineers, influencing architecture, and delivering systems that Support, Marketing, and VIP rely on.
Why Join Us?

Trusted & Profitable:┬áSince 2008, OTGS has grown into a self-funded and stable company supporting over 1.5 million websites worldwide.
Remote-first:┬áJoin a diverse team of smart and friendly people working from all corners of the world.
Creators of WPML:┬áYou'll contribute to the #1 multilingual plugin for WordPress, used by hundreds of thousands of happy clients every day.
Real Impact:┬áYour work will directly improve the experience of users around the globe.
Growth-friendly:┬áWe support your personal and professional development through mentorship, learning tools, and internal opportunities.
Wellbeing focused:┬áWe offer great benefits to help you thrive both in and out of work.

Indicators You're a Great Fit

You are an experienced developer with┬ástrong Python skills.
Believe in┬áwriting tests┬áand clean, reliable code.
Open┬áto using AI in your daily work.

What You'll Do
YouΓÇÖll own high-level goals, shape them into real systems, and get them into production quickly.
If you want ownership, deep engineering work, and the chance to build systems that move things forward, apply today, and weΓÇÖd love to meet you.

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/onthegosystems-senior-python-developer

KFC: Sr. Software Engineer II

Headquarters: Plano, TX, United States
    URL: http://kfc.com


DescriptionWe are seeking a talented and experienced Senior Full Stack Engineer to join our dynamic team at YUM Connect, LLC. In this role, you will play a crucial part in the Pizza Hut US Digital and Technology team, working on contract to support and enhance our mobile and web development efforts. Your expertise in React and React Native will be instrumental in creating exceptional customer-facing applications. Operating in a Kanban environment, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver meaningful product improvements that drive our business forward.Responsibilities Deliver full stack solutions for Pizza Hut US applications across web and mobile platforms. Design and implement scalable, maintainable, and well-tested features with a focus on quality. Partner with product and design teams to define and execute technical solutions that align with business goals. Lead code reviews, ensuring engineering best practices are upheld and maintained. Own and manage technical documentation, reducing technical debt and improving knowledge sharing. Quickly identify and resolve production issues, ensuring smooth operations and an excellent user experience. Explore and leverage GenAI tools to accelerate development processes and enhance productivity. Apply software development best practices, including coding standards, peer reviews, source control management, CI/CD processes, testing, and operational readiness. Collaborate effectively with a small, agile team of engineers, fostering a positive and inclusive work environment.Qualifications 7-10 years of professional software development experience, with a strong focus on full stack development. Proficiency in React and React Native is a must, with a proven track record of delivering high-quality applications. Familiarity with GoLang is preferred, as it will be an asset for certain projects and initiatives. Knowledge of AWS, GitLab Pipelines, and DevOps best practices is advantageous for efficient development and deployment. Comfort working in a fast-paced Kanban environment, able to adapt to changing priorities and deliver results. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders. Solid understanding of software architecture and development fundamentals, ensuring robust and scalable solutions. Relevant Computer Science or IT-related qualifications or equivalent industry experience. A passion for technology, a desire to stay updated with industry trends, and a commitment to continuous learning. Authorization to work in the United States is required, and an immediate start is preferred.

To apply: https://weworkremotely.com/remote-jobs/kfc-sr-software-engineer-ii

Grant Opportunities Funding African Startups Right Now

30 major grant, accelerator, and funding opportunities currently supporting African startups, covering sectors such as:


Fintech and financial inclusion


Climate and clean energy


Agriculture and food systems


Health and life sciences


Legal tech and governance


Creative industries


Youth and women entrepreneurship


Across these programmes, founders can access:


Equity-free grants and catalytic funding


Cloud and technology credits


Accelerators and mentorship


Investor networks and pilot opportunities


Large-scale growth capital


Together, these initiatives form one of the strongest ecosystems of non-dilutive and early-stage support available to African entrepreneurs today.

1. Google for Startups Black Founders Fund ΓÇô Africa
Description:
The Google for Startups Black Founders Fund: Africa supports Black-owned startups with equity-free cash awards, mentorship, and technical support to help founders build and grow their technology ventures. The fund is part of GoogleΓÇÖs broader commitment to empowering underrepresented founders and driving innovation across the continent. Past participants have accessed funding, ongoing support, and cloud credits to accelerate growth.
Benefits:

Cash awards to support business growth without giving up equity
Access to Google mentorship and resources
Google Cloud credits and product support
Enhanced visibility and networking opportunities

Requirements:

Startup must be Black-led
Founders should be actively involved in the business
Technology-based products or services with real growth potential

How to Apply:
Visit the official Google for Startups Black Founders Fund application page and complete the online form.
Deadline:
Check the programme page for the next application deadline and timeline.

2. Tony Elumelu Foundation Entrepreneurship Programme
Description:
The Tony Elumelu Foundation (TEF) Entrepreneurship Programme is a flagship pan-African initiative that provides comprehensive support to entrepreneurs across all 54 African countries. The programme equips founders with training, mentorship, and seed capital to start and grow businesses, promoting job creation and economic development across sectors.
Benefits:

US$5,000 non-refundable seed capital for selected entrepreneurs
12 weeks of world-class business training
Intensive one-on-one mentorship
Membership of AfricaΓÇÖs largest entrepreneurship network via TEFConnect
Networking and visibility with investors and partners

Requirements:

Applicants must be 18 years or older
Business must be in Africa and operational for 0ΓÇô5 years
Organisations must be for-profit and scalable

How to Apply:
Applications are submitted via the TEFConnect digital platform. Register, complete your profile, and submit your business details and proposal.
Deadline:
Applications open 1 January 2026 and close 1 March 2026 (programme cycle).

3. AWS Activate Credits ΓÇô Up to $100,000 in Cloud Credits for Startups
Description:
AWS Activate Credits provide startups with access to cloud computing resources to accelerate product development, scale operations, and experiment with advanced technologies such as AI and machine learning. Startups can apply for cloud credits that can be used on the AWS platform to reduce infrastructure costs.
Benefits:

Up to $100,000 in AWS Activate Credits
Access to AWS infrastructure for hosting, compute, storage, and more
Tools and services to support AI, ML, data analytics, and scalability
Opportunity to leverage AWSΓÇÖs global network and platform capabilities

Requirements:

Startup must be pre-Series B and under 10 years old
Must have a company profile/website
For higher-tier credits (up to $100K), association with an AWS Activate Provider (e.g., accelerator or VC) is typically required

How to Apply:
Sign up for the AWS Activate programme, create an AWS Builder ID, choose your Activate package (Founders or Portfolio) and submit your application here.
Deadline:
Applications are open year-round; credits are issued based on eligibility and approval.

4. Mastercard Foundation Digital Commerce Accelerator
Description:The Digital Commerce Accelerator is an initiative supported by the Mastercard Foundation in partnership with BFA Global and the Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (MEST). It is designed to scale digital commerce solutions that improve the financial resilience of micro and small enterprises (MSEs) in Ghana and potentially expand to other markets. The programme particularly targets innovations that enable informal businesses to adopt digital commerce tools and expand their reach.
Benefits:


Flexible grant funding to support growth (capital funding levels vary by cohort)


Tailored venture acceleration support


Connections to a global Circle of Investors and Corporate Innovators


Access to in-market expertise through MEST and ecosystem partners


Requirements:


Startups offering digital commerce solutions that support micro and small enterprises


Demonstrated potential to improve livelihoods and financial inclusion for informal MSEs


Operate in or target markets where the programme is active, with Ghana being a current focus


How to Apply:Expressions of interest or applications are typically submitted via the Catalyst Fund/BFA Global platform or partner announcement channels. Interested ventures should monitor the Mastercard Foundation and Catalyst Fund websites for the next call for applications.
Deadline:Deadline information varies by cohort and is typically announced on the programmeΓÇÖs official pages when a new round is open.

5. Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub ΓÇô Up to $150,000 in Azure Credits
Description:The Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub provides eligible startups with a suite of support services, tools, and up to $150,000 in Azure credits to build, test, and scale innovative solutions. The programme also includes tailored guidance and access to technical resources that help startups accelerate product development and growth. This initiative aims to level the playing field for early-stage technology ventures by offering enterprise-grade technology and support.Benefits:


Up to $150,000 in Azure credits for cloud computing and services


Technical support and tools from Microsoft


Access to startup development resources, business guidance, and partner ecosystem


Opportunities to connect with co-selling and go-to-market resources


Requirements:


Registered startup company (varies by region)


Technology focus and plan to utilise Azure services


Ability to demonstrate product development and growth potential


How to Apply:Startups can apply through the Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub portal by creating an account, submitting company information, and following the guided application process.
Deadline:Applications are open year-round, and approvals are issued on a rolling basis.

6. Orange Corners Innovation Fund ΓÇô Grants for Early-Stage Tech Startups
Description:The Orange Corners Innovation Fund supports early-stage tech startups across Africa by providing grant funding, mentorship, and ecosystem support to help founders develop business models, refine products, and scale solutions that create positive economic and social impact. The fund is part of the broader Orange Corners initiative, which focuses on youth entrepreneurship and sustainable business development.
Benefits:


Grant funding to support startup development and scaling


Access to mentorship and business support services


Integration into a pan-African network of entrepreneurs and partners


Support in refining business models and accessing markets


Requirements:


Early-stage tech startup with a viable business concept


Founder team typically within the programmeΓÇÖs youth target demographic


Commitment to sustainable impact and inclusive growth


How to Apply:Applications are submitted through the Orange Corners Innovation Fund online portal when calls are open. Applicants need to complete the application form and provide business details and plans.
Deadline:Deadlines vary by batch and region. Prospective applicants should consult the Orange Corners Innovation Fund page for the next open deadline.

7. GSMA Innovation Fund for Climate Resilience and Adaptation
Description:The GSMA Innovation Fund for Climate Resilience and Adaptation supports start-ups, small and growing enterprises (SGEs), and social enterprises that leverage mobile and digital technologies to deliver climate resilience solutions for low-income and vulnerable communities. This fund focuses on innovations that address climate change impacts, strengthen resilience, and improve adaptive capacities in eligible markets including Africa.
Benefits:


Equity-free grant funding ranging from approximately ┬ú100,000 to ┬ú250,000 per project


Tailored technical assistance and mentoring


Networking and showcasing opportunities


Facilitation of partnerships with industry stakeholders such as mobile network operators


Support with monitoring, evaluation, and capacity building


Requirements:


Must be a registered legal entity and able to receive grant funds


Active users and revenue in at least one eligible market, including African countries


Must demonstrate a technology solution that contributes to climate resilience or climate adaptation for vulnerable populations


Start-ups and SGEs must have adequate financial systems to report expenditure and comply with grant requirements


How to Apply:Interested organisations should review the Innovation Fund terms and eligibility criteria on the GSMA mobile for development website and register on the grant management platform when the next funding round opens. Application details, forms, and timelines are published on the GSMA site and through their newsletters.
Deadline:Application deadlines vary by funding round. Prospective applicants should subscribe for updates and monitor the official GSMA Innovation Fund page for the announcement of the next open call.

8. Africa Food Security Challenge (USAID & Prosper Africa Partnership)
Description:The Africa Food Security Challenge is a grant initiative under the USAID Africa Trade and Investment (ATI) programme ΓÇö supported by Prosper Africa ΓÇö aimed at accelerating solutions that tackle food security and food systems resilience challenges in Africa. The challenge invites applications from agricultural value chain enterprises and agritech ventures that can improve access to food inputs, technologies, and market solutions, and strengthen resilience to food shocks and supply disruptions.
Benefits:


Grant awards from approximately Sh59.9 million to Sh598.9 million (Kenyan Shillings) for eligible agribusinesses and start-ups working on impactful, resilient food security models


Funding to support scaling of inputs, technologies, logistics, and solutions that address food availability and access


Opportunity to partner with USAID and implement high-impact, scalable agricultural innovations across Africa


Requirements:


Business must operate within the agricultural value chain and contribute to improved food security outcomes


Demonstrate a viable concept that responds to food systems challenges such as input delivery, processing, storage, trade, or distribution


Proposal must align with programme objectives and show potential for measurable impact on food availability or resilience


How to Apply:Interested enterprises should prepare a concept note addressing the challengeΓÇÖs objectives and submit it through the official USAID ATI / Prosper Africa application process when the call is open. Specific application links and details are published when the funding round is active.
Deadline:Deadlines depend on the specific call announcement and published guidance under the Prosper Africa initiative; applicants should monitor USAID ATI / Prosper Africa grant postings for the next cycle.

9. Shell Foundation Catalytic Grants
Description:Shell Foundation provides catalytic funding to enterprises working on energy access, climate solutions, mobility, and inclusive economic growth in emerging markets, including Africa. The programme focuses on ventures with commercially viable models that deliver strong development impact.
Benefits:


Grant funding to pilot and scale solutions


Technical assistance and business advisory


Access to investor networks and corporate partners


Long-term partnership opportunities


Requirements:


Early- to growth-stage enterprise operating in Africa or similar markets


Focus on clean energy, climate resilience, or inclusive livelihoods


Demonstrated business model and social impact


Capacity to scale


How to Apply:Applicants submit proposals through Shell FoundationΓÇÖs official funding calls when open, usually via online application forms published on their website.
Deadline:Varies by funding round; applicants should monitor upcoming calls.

10. CGIAR Digital Innovation Fund
Description:The CGIAR Digital Innovation Fund supports the development and deployment of digital tools for agriculture, including data platforms, advisory services, AI systems, and climate-smart technologies aimed at farmers and food systems in Africa and other regions.
Benefits:


Grant funding for pilots and research-to-market solutions


Technical collaboration with CGIAR research centres


Support for testing and scaling innovations


Visibility within global agriculture networks


Requirements:


Organisation or consortium working in agri-tech or digital agriculture


Solution must improve productivity, sustainability, or resilience


Ability to pilot within developing-country contexts


Compliance with CGIAR research and reporting standards


How to Apply:Applications are submitted through CGIARΓÇÖs innovation or digital transformation calls published on its website.
Deadline:Depends on the specific call for proposals.

11. Global Innovation Fund
Description:The Global Innovation Fund (GIF) invests in innovations that improve lives and reduce poverty in low- and middle-income countries, including African nations. Funding supports solutions in health, education, climate resilience, agriculture, and financial inclusion.
Benefits:


Funding from USD 50,000 to USD 15 million


Grants, risk capital, or equity investments


Technical support and scaling assistance


Connections to governments and global partners


Requirements:


Innovation must target poverty reduction


Evidence-based or scalable business model


Operations in eligible developing countries


Ability to demonstrate measurable impact


How to Apply:Applicants submit an online proposal through the Global Innovation Fund website at any time.
Deadline:Rolling applications year-round.

12. MetLife Foundation Financial Solutions Lab
Description:The Financial Solutions Lab, supported by MetLife Foundation, funds and accelerates enterprises developing solutions for financial inclusion, resilience, and consumer protection in underserved markets, including parts of Africa.
Benefits:


Grant funding or catalytic capital


Accelerator-style technical support


Mentorship from financial sector experts


Access to investors and ecosystem partners


Requirements:


Startup or social enterprise focused on inclusive finance


Product addressing affordability, access, or consumer protection


Scalable business model


Willingness to participate in programme activities


How to Apply:Applications are submitted when open through the Financial Solutions Lab platform or partner accelerator websites.
Deadline:Varies by cohort and funding cycle.

13. BFA Global Catalyst Fund
Description:The BFA Global Catalyst Fund supports early-stage ventures developing financial inclusion and fintech solutions that expand access to quality financial services for underserved populations in Africa and other emerging markets.
Benefits:


Early-stage grant funding


Technical assistance and product design support


Piloting opportunities with partners


Access to investors and ecosystem networks


Requirements:


Fintech or digital financial service startup


Solution addressing inclusion, affordability, or consumer protection


Early-stage but operational product or pilot


Willingness to collaborate with fund partners


How to Apply:Applications are submitted through BFA GlobalΓÇÖs innovation programme portals when calls are announced.
Deadline:Varies by funding cycle.

14. Visa Foundation Everywhere Initiative
Description:The Visa Foundation Everywhere Initiative supports startups developing inclusive fintech and digital payment solutions that broaden access to financial services for small businesses and underserved communities in Africa.
Benefits:


Grant funding or prize awards


Mentorship from Visa and ecosystem partners


Business development exposure


Opportunities to pilot solutions


Requirements:


Startup operating in fintech or digital payments


Focus on financial inclusion


Scalable business model


Legally registered business


How to Apply:Startups apply through regional Visa Foundation challenge portals when open.
Deadline:Depends on regional competition timelines.

15. Cartier WomenΓÇÖs Initiative
Description:The Cartier WomenΓÇÖs Initiative is a global entrepreneurship programme supporting women-led impact businesses addressing social and environmental challenges, including ventures operating in Africa.
Benefits:


Funding of up to USD 100,000 for top awardees


Executive coaching and mentoring


International visibility and networking


Leadership development programmes


Requirements:


Woman founder or co-founder in a leadership role


For-profit business with social or environmental impact


Early to growth stage


Operational for at least one year

Grant funding or seed capital


Business training and mentorship


Market access and showcasing opportunities


Industry partnerships

Business coaching and training


Investor access


Peer network and alumni community

Woman founder or co-founder


Africa-based startup

One-to-one mentoring


Business training


Market access support

Commitment to mentoring programme

Accelerator programme and technical mentorship


Access to Johnson & Johnson expertise and partners


Support for piloting and scaling health innovations

Capacity to scale impact

Research and innovation support


Access to continental networks


Pathways to larger funding rounds

Opportunities for follow-on funding

Bloomberg Journalism Programs ΓÇô USA: Fully Funded Business Journalism Training in New York

The Bloomberg Journalism Programs ΓÇô USA offer an exceptional opportunity for degree-seeking students in the United States to strengthen their skills in business and economic reporting. Organized in collaboration with Bloomberg News, the UNC Hussman School of Journalism and Media, and the Graduate School of Journalism at UC Berkeley, the New York program is designed to introduce students to the fast-paced world where business, markets, government, labor, wealth, and power intersect.
Held from May 18ΓÇô22, 2026, this fully funded program invites students to New York City for an intensive week of reporting workshops, seminars, and newsroom-style training. All travel, lodging, and meals are covered for selected participants.

What the Bloomberg Journalism Program Offers
Throughout the week, participants learn directly from Bloomberg journalists and executives, including Matt Winkler, co-founder and editor-in-chief emeritus of Bloomberg News. Additional instruction is provided by faculty from UNC-Chapel Hill and UC Berkeley, blending professional newsroom expertise with academic insight.
Students gain practical training in:

Understanding financial markets and core economic concepts
Fundamentals of business journalismΓÇöone of the most in-demand media specializations
Writing and reporting techniques through hands-on workshops
Approaches to editing, data interpretation, and applied business knowledge
The essential role of diverse representation in journalism

Participants also join a growing community of program alumni who remain connected through mentorship and ongoing support as they build their journalism careers.

Program Schedule
Location: New York City
Key Dates:

February 28, 2026: Application deadline
March 19 ΓÇô April 1: Finalists notified
May 18ΓÇô22, 2026: Program dates


Who Should Apply
This program is designed for:

University students with a strong interest in pursuing a career in journalism
Rising juniors and seniors from all academic disciplines
Students from diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and lived experiences
Individuals not currently studying business journalism, but eager to understand it
Full-time international students studying in the U.S. (with institutional permission for travel support and stipends)

The program encourages applications from students committed to storytelling, economic literacy, and impactful reporting.

How to Apply
Application Deadline: February 28, 2026.
Early submission is encouraged.
Applicants must complete the online application and upload the following materials:

A current r├⌐sum├⌐
An unofficial transcript
One 500-word writing sample: Identify your role model in journalism and explain the attributes you admire
Contact information for one faculty reference

Finalists will be invited to a video-conference interview after the application deadline.

What Alumni Say
Past participants consistently highlight the value of the experience:

ΓÇ£The advice we received will set us so far ahead in our careersΓÇöan opportunity we wouldnΓÇÖt find anywhere else.ΓÇ¥
ΓÇ£The networking was incredible. You simply cannot replicate this online.ΓÇ¥
ΓÇ£I learned how expansive business journalism truly isΓÇöfrom equality to environmental reporting. The ΓÇÿArt of the InterviewΓÇÖ session was transformative.ΓÇ¥
ΓÇ£The diversity in the room was palpableΓÇöour different stories made the learning experience powerful.ΓÇ¥

These testimonials reflect the programΓÇÖs commitment to inclusive learning, professional development, and community building.

About the BloombergΓÇôUNCΓÇôBerkeley Partnership
Launched in 2017, the partnership aims to:

Introduce emerging journalists to the dynamic field of business journalism
Increase diversity in the industry
Provide unparalleled access to BloombergΓÇÖs newsroom and leading journalists

In 2019, the program expanded to the United Kingdom through a collaboration with City, University of London. To date, more than 160 students have benefited from this initiative.

Bloomberg News and Bloomberg LP
Bloomberg News employs 2,700 journalists and analysts across 120 countries, delivering over 5,000 stories daily through the Bloomberg Terminal and Bloomberg Media GroupΓÇÖs digital, TV, radio, print, and streaming platforms. Bloomberg LP continues to shape the global information economy through innovative data, news, and analytics solutions.

Application Information

Included Venture Capital(VC) Global Fellowship Class of 2026: Applications Now Open

Breaking into Venture Capital (VC) has traditionally been difficultΓÇöespecially for individuals from underrepresented, overlooked, or non-traditional backgrounds. Included VC is changing that narrative.
Included VC is a global initiative on a mission to radically transform the venture capital ecosystem by making it more inclusive, representative, and accessible. Through its highly competitive and fully funded Global Venture Capital Fellowship, Included VC equips diverse talent from around the world with the skills, mentorship, network, and confidence needed to break into VC and thrive.
Applications are now open for the Included VC Global Fellowship ΓÇô Class of 2026, and registration takes as little as 21 seconds.

What Is the Included VC Global Fellowship?
The Included VC Fellowship is a six-month, fully funded, part-time global venture capital program, often described as a ΓÇ£unique VC MBA.ΓÇ¥ It is designed for aspiring venture capitalists who are serious about building a career in VC but may not have followed the traditional pathways into the industry.
The Fellowship sources and supports exceptional talent globally, particularly individuals from communities historically excluded from venture capital. Fellows gain access to world-class education, hands-on experience, and mentorship from leading investors and VC professionals across the globe.
This is not a generic online course. Included VC delivers learning and exposure that participants consistently say cannot be found anywhere else.

The Mission Behind Included VC
Included VC exists to change the face of venture capital.
The organization believes that a strong societyΓÇöand a strong investment ecosystemΓÇödepends on diversity of thought, experience, and background. By increasing representation within VC, Included VC aims to create meaningful, multi-generational change across the global startup and investment landscape.
At its core, Included VC is guided by four foundational values:

Kindness
Paying It Forward
DonΓÇÖt Compete
Sparkle (quite literally)

These values shape the Fellowship culture, the community, and the long-term relationships built within the Included VC ecosystem.

What Fellows Gain From the Fellowship
Included VC goes far beyond theory. The Fellowship combines deep technical knowledge with real-world application and strong community support.
Key Features Include:

In-depth masterclasses and foundational VC training
Investment committee simulations
Financial modeling and cap table analysis
Deal sourcing and due diligence
Term sheets, fund structure, and legal frameworks
Career coaching and personal brand building
Peer-to-peer learning and office hours
Mentorship from world-class investors
AMAs (Ask-Me-Anything sessions) with industry leaders

The program is global and virtual, with optional in-person summits that bring Fellows, Alumni, and Venture Partners together for deeper learning and connection.

Fully Funded Opportunity
The Fellowship is fully funded, thanks to the generosity of sponsors committed to changing the VC landscape. These include leading global funds and institutions such as:
BITKRAFT, Creandum, Daphni, European Investment Fund, K Fund, HSBC Ventures, HV Capital, Mouro Capital, Mangrove Capital, Notion Capital, Seedcamp, and Wilson Sonsini, among others.
Please note: There is an application fee.

Who Should Apply?
Included VC actively encourages applications from individuals who may feel they ΓÇ£donΓÇÖt fit the typical VC profile.ΓÇ¥

You should apply if:
You are serious about breaking into venture capital
You have tried (or are trying) to enter VC and faced barriers
You are a student, a parent, a career-switcher, or a professional from a non-tech or non-finance background
You value community, mentorship, and long-term impact

You do not need to already work in VC. What matters most is your commitment, curiosity, and drive.

Time Commitment & Structure
The Fellowship is part-time, allowing Fellows to work or study alongside the program. Participants should expect to dedicate 15+ hours per week, including coursework, assignments, personal development, and live sessions.
Most masterclasses and workshops take place 1ΓÇô2 times per week, typically between 17:00ΓÇô20:00 UK time.

Proven Impact: Hear From Fellows
Included VC alumni consistently describe the Fellowship as life-changing. Many Fellows secure VC roles during or shortly after completing the program, often crediting Included VCΓÇÖs reputation, rigorous vetting, and powerful network.
Beyond professional growth, Fellows highlight the strong sense of belonging, lifelong friendships, and global support system that sets Included VC apart from traditional diversity initiatives.
As one Fellow shared, Included VC provides ΓÇ£all the benefits of being a ΓÇÿnepo babyΓÇÖΓÇöwithout being born into privilege.ΓÇ¥

Why Included VC Is Different
Included VC is not just about accessΓÇöitΓÇÖs about excellence, community, and long-term transformation. Fellows are challenged, supported, and empowered to grow both professionally and personally.
Once accepted, you are not simply completing a programΓÇöyou are joining a global family that supports your career for life.

Apply Now
Registrations for the Included VC Global Fellowship Class of 2026 are officially open.
Find out more from HERE
If you are ready to gain insider VC knowledge, build a powerful global network, and be part of a movement reshaping venture capitalΓÇöthis opportunity is for you.
Together, letΓÇÖs continue to change the face of VC.

Subscribe to OFY┬áfor more opportunities like thisΓÇª

2026 Global Youth Action Fund Opens Applications for Young Changemakers Worldwide

The Global Youth Action Fund (GYAF) 2026 is now open to applications from young people aged 12 to 19 who have bold ideas to improve their communities. This global grant programme supports youth-led projects that address real-world challenges and contribute to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
Created by the International Baccalaureate (IB) as a pathway to action for the Festival of Hope, the Global Youth Action Fund provides funding, mentorship, and global visibility to help young changemakers turn their ideas into tangible impact.
About the Global Youth Action Fund
Each year, the Global Youth Action Fund selects a small number of outstanding projects from hundreds of applications submitted worldwide. Selected projects are recognised for their creativity, purpose, leadership, and potential to inspire change beyond their local communities.
Winning applicants join an international network of young leaders and receive support to strengthen, implement, and scale their initiatives.
What Selected Projects Receive
Successful applicants will benefit from:

Grant funding to implement their community project
Mentorship and guidance from experienced educators and youth advocates
Global recognition and visibility through IB and partner platforms
Entry into an international community of youth leaders driving social change
Opportunities to connect with peers working on the SDGs worldwide

Who Can Apply
The opportunity is open to:

Young people aged 12ΓÇô19 years
Individuals or teams with a project idea that addresses a real community challenge
Youth committed to leadership, collaboration, and sustainable impact

Applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, and projects from any country are eligible.
How Applications Are Assessed
Applications are reviewed by an international panel of experts, educators, and youth advocates based on:

Purpose and vision ΓÇô clarity of the problem and solution
Creativity and innovation ΓÇô originality and ability to inspire action
Impact and sustainability ΓÇô potential for lasting change
Collaboration and leadership ΓÇô ability to engage and motivate others

Applicants are encouraged to use digital tools responsibly, but submissions must reflect the applicantΓÇÖs authentic voice.
Why Apply
Applying to the Global Youth Action Fund means joining a global movement of young people transforming hope into action. Selected applicants stand among some of the worldΓÇÖs most promising youth leaders, turning local ideas into global impact.
Key Deadline

Application deadline: Saturday, 31 January 2026 at 5:00 PM

Late applications will not be considered.
For more details about this opportunity,┬áclick here.
APPLY NOW
For more opportunities, click here.

Opportunities to connect with peers working on the SDGs worldwide

Who Can Apply
The opportunity is open to:

Young people aged 12ΓÇô19 years
Individuals or teams with a project idea that addresses a real community challenge
Youth committed to leadership, collaboration, and sustainable impact

Applicants from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, and projects from any country are eligible.
How Applications Are Assessed
Applications are reviewed by an international panel of experts, educators, and youth advocates based on:

Purpose and vision ΓÇô clarity of the problem and solution
Creativity and innovation ΓÇô originality and ability to inspire action
Impact and sustainability ΓÇô potential for lasting change
Collaboration and leadership ΓÇô ability to engage and motivate others

Applicants are encouraged to use digital tools responsibly, but submissions must reflect the applicantΓÇÖs authentic voice.
Why Apply
Applying to the Global Youth Action Fund means joining a global movement of young people transforming hope into action. Selected applicants stand among some of the worldΓÇÖs most promising youth leaders, turning local ideas into global impact.
Key Deadline

Application deadline: Saturday, 31 January 2026 at 5:00 PM

Late applications will not be considered.
For more details about this opportunity,┬áclick here.
APPLY NOW
For more opportunities, click here.

fields.raw_text:
Her Africa Early-Stage Incubator (HAESI) 2026 Cohort: the Alliance for Women and Girls (AFWAG)

Across Africa, young leaders are driving transformative change in gender justice, womenΓÇÖs empowerment, and community development. Yet, many of these innovators face significant challenges: limited access to networks, scarce resources, and insufficient systems to scale their impact. Recognizing these barriers, the Alliance for Women and Girls (AFWAG) has launched the Her Africa Early-Stage Incubator (HAESI), a fully funded program designed to support founders under the age of 35 who are building solutions for women and girls.
The 2026 cohort of HAESI is now open for applications, offering a unique opportunity for early-stage leaders to strengthen their initiatives, expand their reach, and influence broader societal norms and policies.

What HAESI Offers
The Her Africa Early-Stage Incubator is not just a training programΓÇöit is a comprehensive leadership journey that equips participants with tools, networks, and practices to sustain long-term impact. The 2026 cohort will provide:

Six-Month Leadership Journey Participants will engage in a structured program that emphasizes personal growth, organizational development, and strategic leadership. This journey is designed to help founders refine their vision, strengthen their management skills, and build resilience in the face of challenges.
Pan-African Houses & Peer Exchange Collaboration lies at the heart of HAESI. Founders will join Pan-African Houses, fostering peer-to-peer learning and cross-cultural exchange. These networks encourage participants to share experiences, learn from diverse contexts, and co-create solutions that resonate across the continent.
Systems-Level Tools Beyond project management, HAESI equips leaders with systems-level approaches to tackle structural barriers. This includes frameworks for influencing policy, shifting narratives, and embedding gender justice into broader social and economic systems.
Community Care and Liberatory Practice Recognizing the importance of wellbeing, the incubator integrates practices of community care and liberation. Participants are encouraged to prioritize mental health, collective healing, and sustainable activism, ensuring that their leadership is both impactful and enduring.
Networks That Last Beyond the Programme One of HAESIΓÇÖs most valuable offerings is its enduring network. Alumni remain connected through ongoing collaborations, mentorship opportunities, and shared advocacy efforts, creating a Pan-African community of gender justice leaders.


Why HAESI Matters
For many early-stage founders, the journey of building solutions for women and girls can be isolating. Without access to supportive ecosystems, promising initiatives risk stagnation or collapse. HAESI addresses this gap by providing a platform where leaders can thrive collectively.
The incubator is particularly significant because it goes beyond supporting individual projects. Its focus on influencing norms, narratives, and policy ensures that participants are equipped to drive systemic change. This approach recognizes that gender justice is not achieved through isolated interventions but through sustained efforts that reshape societal structures.

Eligibility and Application
The 2026 cohort is open to founders under 35 years old who are actively building solutions for women and girls in Africa. Applicants should demonstrate a commitment to gender justice and a readiness to engage in a six-month leadership journey.
Applications are currently being accepted through the official HAESI portal. Interested candidates are encouraged to apply promptly to secure their place in this transformative program.

The Her Africa Early-Stage Incubator represents a bold step toward nurturing the next generation of gender justice leaders in Africa. By offering a fully funded, six-month program that combines leadership development, peer exchange, systems-level tools, and community care, HAESI empowers young founders to scale their impact and influence societal transformation.
For early-stage leaders under 35, this is an invitation to join a Pan-African movement dedicated to advancing the rights and wellbeing of women and girls. Apply now and become part of a community that is reshaping AfricaΓÇÖs future.
The post Her Africa Early-Stage Incubator (HAESI) 2026 Cohort: the Alliance for Women and Girls (AFWAG) appeared first on Opportunities for Youth.
